name: Lunaris (Jonathan Cauldwell)
description:
This is a flip-screen game for the 48K/128K Spectrum with rotational controls.  The player's mission is to collect all the orbs on each level before progressing to the next.  Levels two and beyond feature enemy gun turrets that fire at the player (thankfully their aim isn't good) and these can be destroyed with the ship's laser cannon if required.  A password system is implemented so the player can skip straight to the level on which he lost his last ship.

Lunaris is a frustrating but highly playable game that takes a while to master.  Written in fast-action machine code for the 48K or 128K Spectrum.  Redefinable keys and Kempston joystick support.

A ZX Spectrum emulator is required.
